Fortunate Turn of Events.name: Fortunate Turn of Events
Fortunate Turn of Events.flavor: An enemy’s failed attack triggers a welcome, though suspiciously convenient backlash from a nearby hazard.
Fortunate Turn of Events.trigger: An enemy within 10 squares misses you with an attack
Fortunate Turn of Events.target: The triggering attacker and each enemy adjacent to it
Fortunate Turn of Events.onHit: 2d8 + Charisma modifier damage. The damage is of one type you resist with your Wild Soul class feature (if you have multiple resistances from your Wild Soul feature, choose one type). If you rolled an even number on this attack roll, the target is knocked prone. If you rolled an odd number on this attack roll, you slide the target 3 squares.

Just Not Their Day.name: Just Not Their Day
Just Not Their Day.flavor: You trigger an unending series of painful complications, coincidences, and calamities that strike your enemy simultaneously.
Just Not Their Day.effect: Before making the following attack, choose 1–10 or 11–20. If the result on the die for the attack roll is within the range you chose, this attack deals 2d12 extra damage, even on a miss.
Just Not Their Day.onHit: 3d12 + Charisma modifier damage and you slide the target 3 squares and knock it prone. The damage is of one type you resist with your Wild Soul class feature (if you have multiple resistances from your Wild Soul feature, choose one type).
Just Not Their Day.onMiss: Half damage, and you slide the target 1 square.

Even the Odds.name: Even the Odds
Even the Odds.trigger: You, an ally, or an enemy in the burst makes an attack roll, skill check, or saving throw.
Even the Odds.effect: Roll 1d6, and either add or subtract the result from the triggering roll.
